comments:
I'm using a profile that is connected to an Oracle driver.

A NPE occures when I try to open a user defined function (from the datasource explorer):

Btw. Trying to open a stored procedure openes an editor that states:
Failed to get source.

From the looks of things, the routine being processed has a null object in its containment list.  Need to investigate the catalog loader code to see how it got in there.  Temporary fix is to test for null.
i've modified the generic ddl generation code.  you might want to give tomorrow's or monday's build a try to see if the problem has been fixed.
moving to future pending further information.
Stefan, can you verify this with DTP 1.5 to see if it's been resolved?
Using dtp 1.5 I was able to open procedures and functions.
The editor opens but shows only the declaration of the function/procedure. The content is 'shortened' by the string 'NO_SQL'.
Cool. Tbanks. So can we consider this fixed then?

So with the NO_SQL issue, that's actually a case where the model isn't totally being filled out. Have you tried with Oracle's new Enablement profile that's available from their site?

Check out: http://oss.oracle.com/dbplugin-eclipse-dtp.html
Thanks for your hint. It works fine with these plugins.
Considering this one fixed courtesy of the Oracle Enablement plug-ins
